Authors: Feng Xu, Donald H Pfister, Katherine F LoBuglio
Title:
On the co-occurrence of species of Wynnea (Ascomycota,
Pezizales, Sarcoscyphaceae) and Armillaria (Basidiomycota, Agaricales,
Physalacriaceae).
Abstract:
Species of the genus Wynnea are collected in association
with a subterranean mass generally referred to as a sclerotium. This is
one of the few genera of the Sarcoscyphaceae not associated with plant
material – wood or leaves. The sclerotium is composed of hyphae of both
Armillaria species and Wynnea species. To verify the existence of
Armillaria species in the sclerotia of those Wynnea species not
previously examined and to fully understand the structure and nature of
the sclerotium, molecular data and morphological characters were
analyzed. Using nuclear ITS rDNA sequences of the Armillaria species
were identified from all examined material. The Armillaria species fall
into two clades  the A. gallica-calvescens-sinapina clade and the A.
mellea clade. Divergent time estimates of the Armillaria and Wynnea
lineages support a cophylogenetic relationship between these two
fungi.

trees.title: Wynnea comb SSU ITS LSU NJ
